revised_title: John Franklin Enders: A Pioneering Life in Medicine and Microbiology
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of John Franklin Enders, a prominent figure in medicine and microbiology. Born into a wealthy family, Enders initially studied English literature but later switched to bacteriology and microbiology, eventually becoming a Higgins University Professor at Harvard. His work in virology led to the discovery of the polio virus and earned him the Nobel Prize. Enders was known for his mentorship and support of his research team, fostering a collaborative environment that produced significant scientific achievements.
